intro: Guarea schomburgkii, commonly known as the "schefflera" or "palo de tinta," is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in diameter. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, followed by spherical, woody fruits that split open to release seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is also cultivated as a houseplant in temperate regions.
